## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
current_dir = 'D:/GWU/Aihan/DATS 6101 Data Science/Mid-Project'
setwd(current_dir)
df = read.csv("cars.csv", header = T, stringsAsFactors = TRUE)
df2 = df[c('manufacturer_name', 'model_name', 'transmission', 'color', 'odometer_value', 'year_produced', 'engine_capacity', 'body_type', 'price_usd', 'number_of_photos', 'up_counter', 'duration_listed')]

df2 = df[c( 'transmission', 'color', 'odometer_value', 'year_produced', 'engine_capacity', 'body_type', 'price_usd', 'number_of_photos', 'up_counter', 'duration_listed')]
summary(df2)


boxplot(df['manufacturer_name'], df['price_usd'])
car_lm = lm(price_usd ~ ., data = df2)
summary(car_lm)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
library(s20x)
pairs20x(df2)
```
```{r}
library(ezids)
loadPkg("corrplot")
corrplot(df2)
```
